result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn P. McConnell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
Court finds defendant is entitled to jail credit if revoked. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn P. McConnell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (14CF520, 14CF702, filed in 14CF789)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:33 am 
INCLUDES 14CF520, 14CF702, AND 14CF789. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person with Atty John Bliss. 

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 14CF702. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. 

PLEA HEARING IN 14CF520, 14CF702, AND 14CF789.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to:
In 14CF520: Ct. 1 (Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Harm/Repeater)>>AMEND to Misd. Battery/Repeater pursuant to 940.19(1). 
In 14CF789: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF520: Amended Ct. 1 (Misd. Battery/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CF702: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Bliss makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 30 months probation on each count to run concurrent - CONDITIONS: absolute sobriety; AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds def is entitled to 1 day jail credit in 14CF520 and 2 days jail credit in 14CF702 if revoked. 
Atty Bliss requests cash bond be returned to surety. COURT grants. 
Adj: 9:49 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 25, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 19, 2014 at 08:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report.  No alcohol.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.
